what: Access and Analyze the Data from the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru
title: Access and Analyze the Data from the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru
text: R package redbookperu provides convenient access information contained Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. book represents comprehensive compilation data Peru’s endemic plant species, encompassing records 5,508 distinct taxa. Although document marked milestone consolidating ambitious initiative focused understanding diversity Peru’s endemic plant species time publication, currently requires review update presented taxonomic information. process accessing data original publication can pose challenges researchers, particularly due large number taxa presented within . redbookperu package primary objective addressing challenges providing updated taxonomic information. Additionally, introduces functions designed enhance accessibility usefulness data presented Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. information included redbookperu package built support Taxonomic Name Resolution Service TNRS, collaboration World Checklist Vascular Plants WCVP database. resources utilized ensure validity standardization taxonomic information provide.

title: Access and Analyze the Data from the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru
text: can install ppendemic package CRAN using: can install development version redbookperu GitHub:

title: Access and Analyze the Data from the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru
text: installing redbookperu package, can load R session using: determine species interest listed Red Book Endemic Plants Peru, provide check_redbook() function. function verifies whether species interest included book’s species list. function comes two variations: Species Name: Provides currently accepted name species. Taxonomic Status: Includes following categories: “Accepted name” species name recorded remains valid currently, “Updated name” species whose scientific name recorded time publication now considered synonymous, “opinion” species whose name presents difficulties determining current taxonomic status, “Non info. available” species updated information hasn’t found WCVP database. species interest doesn’t match species list, response “endemic”. check_redbook(splist, tax_status == FALSE): result indicates whether species endemic , based match species present database. functions indicate presence partial matches (fuzzy match) name species interest varies compared information present database. check_redbook() function designed work seamlessly tibbles, allowing users easily analyze species data within tabular format. intend access information provided species listed Red Book Endemic Plants Peru, option use get_redbook_data() function. function facilitates association updated taxonomic information details concerning conservation status, distribution, descriptions presented original publication.
code: library(redbookperu) #> This is redbookperu 0.0.0.2 splist <- c("Aphelandra cuscoenses", "Sanchezia capitata",             "Sanchezia ovata", "Piper stevensi",             "Verbesina andinaa", "Verbesina andina", "Weinmania nubigena")  check_redbook(splist, tax_status = TRUE) #> [1] "Aphelandra cuscoensis - Accepted name - Fuzzy match" #> [2] "Sanchezia ovata - Updated name"                      #> [3] "Sanchezia ovata - Accepted name"                     #> [4] "Piper stevensii - No opinion - Fuzzy match"          #> [5] "Verbesina andina - No info. available - Fuzzy match" #> [6] "Verbesina andina - No info. available"               #> [7] "Weinmania nubigena - Not endemic" check_redbook(splist, tax_status = FALSE) #> [1] "Endemic - fuzzy match" "Endemic"               "Endemic"               #> [4] "Endemic - fuzzy match" "Endemic - fuzzy match" "Endemic"               #> [7] "Not endemic" tibble::tibble(splist = splist) |>    dplyr::mutate(endemic_tax_status = check_redbook(splist, tax_status = TRUE),                 endemic = check_redbook(splist, tax_status = FALSE)) # A tibble: 7 × 3   splist                endemic_tax_status                                  endemic                 <chr>                 <chr>                                               <chr>                 1 Aphelandra cuscoenses Aphelandra cuscoensis - Accepted name - Fuzzy match Endemic - fuzzy match 2 Sanchezia capitata    Sanchezia ovata - Updated name                      Endemic               3 Sanchezia ovata       Sanchezia ovata - Accepted name                     Endemic               4 Piper stevensi        Piper stevensii - No opinion - Fuzzy match          Endemic - fuzzy match 5 Verbesina andinaa     Verbesina andina - No info. available - Fuzzy match Endemic - fuzzy match 6 Verbesina andina      Verbesina andina - No info. available               Endemic               7 Weinmania nubigena    Weinmania nubigena - Not endemic                    Not endemic get_redbook_data(c("Sanchecia capitata",                    "Weinmania nubigena",                    "Macroclinium christensonii",                    "Weberbauera violacea")) #>                name_subitted              accepted_name accepted_family #> 1         Sanchecia capitata            Sanchezia ovata     Acanthaceae #> 2         Weinmania nubigena                       nill            nill #> 3 Macroclinium christensonii Macroclinium christensonii     Orchidaceae #> 4       Weberbauera violacea       Weberbauera violacea    Brassicaceae #>   accepted_name_author               redbook_name        iucn #> 1          Ruiz & Pav.         Sanchezia capitata          DD #> 2                 nill                       nill        nill #> 3            D.E.Benn. Macroclinium christensonii CR, B1abiii #> 4           Al-Shehbaz       Weberbauera violacea          DD #>                                   publication #> 1 Bull. Herb. Boissier, ser. 2, 4: 315. 1904. #> 2                                        nill #> 3    Brittonia 46(3): 249 - 251, f. 13. 1994. #> 4         Novon 14(3): 266 - 268, f. 3. 2004. #>                              collector herbariums  common_name dep_registry #> 1                  A. Mathews 1230 (K)       <NA> Desconocido.      JU - PA #> 2                                 nill       nill         nill         nill #> 3 O. del Castillo ex D.E. Bennett 5160        NY. Desconocido.           JU #> 4        A. Sagástegui A. et al. 11175  MO; HUT!. Desconocido.           CA #>                ecological_regions      sinampe peruvian_herbariums #> 1 BMHP, BHA; altitud desconocida. Sin registro            Ninguno. #> 2                            nill         nill                nill #> 3                   BMHM; 1800 m. Sin registro            Ninguno. #> 4                    PAR; 3800 m. Sin registro      HUT (isotipo). #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             remarks #> 1               Esta especie arbustiva es conocida de dos localidades. La colección tipo fue recolectada en la cuenca del Pangoa en el siglo XVIII. Probablemente la expansión urbana y las actividades agrícolas sean problemas para esta especie. #> 2                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              nill #> 3 Esta hierba epífita es conocida sólo de la colección tipo, proveniente del valle de Chanchamayo, en una subcuenca del Perené. Esta región ha sufrido continuas reducciones de sus áreas naturales debido a la ampliación de la frontera agrícola. #> 4                                                            Esta hierba paramuna es conocida de la localidad tipo, en la cuenca del Crisnejas, un tributario del Marañón. El ejemplar tipo fue recolectado en 1983, de una jalca poco herborizada.

what: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbook
title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbook
text: function checks list species names Red Book Endemic Plants Peru database provides information whether species recorded endemic, current taxonomic status, checks misspelling typos (fuzzy match).

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbook
Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbook
text: splist character vector containing species names checked. tax_status Logical value indicating whether provide taxonomic status information. TRUE, provide taxonomic status information. FALSE, provide endemism information. max_distance Maximum allowed distance fuzzy matching species names.

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbook
text: character vector information taxonomic status endemism provided species names.

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbook
text: function checks species name provided list Red Book Endemic Plants Peru database. performs fuzzy matching based specified maximum distance. output inform taxonomic status: ) "Accepted name" input names recorded valid, b) "Updated name", input name currently synonym, c) "opinion", current taxonomic status input name undefined, d) "info. available" species names recorded Red Book found WCVP database name status validation. output name group species name recorded original publication.
code: The output also returns information about possible misspelling,      adding "fuzzy match" to the output when a typo is found.

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbook
text: Red Book Endemic Plants Peru World Checklist Vascular Plants, continuously updated resource exploring global plant diversity. Taxonomic Name Resolution Service - TNRS Plants World Online - Facilitated Royal Botanic Gardens - Kew.

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbook
code: # Example usage of the function splist <- c("Aphelandra cuscoenses", "Sanchezia capitata",             "Sanchezia ovata", "Piper stevensi",             "Verbesina andinaa", "Verbesina andina")  result_tax <- check_redbook(splist, tax_status = TRUE) print(result_tax) #> [1] "Aphelandra cuscoensis - Accepted name - Fuzzy match" #> [2] "Sanchezia ovata - Updated name"                      #> [3] "Sanchezia ovata - Accepted name"                     #> [4] "Piper stevensii - No opinion - Fuzzy match"          #> [5] "Verbesina andina - No info. available - Fuzzy match" #> [6] "Verbesina andina - No info. available"                result_endemism <- check_redbook(splist, tax_status = FALSE) print(result_endemism) #> [1] "Endemic - fuzzy match" "Endemic"               "Endemic"               #> [4] "Endemic - fuzzy match" "Endemic - fuzzy match" "Endemic"

what: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: function retrieves information Red Book Endemic Plants Peru database provided list species. associates provided species names corresponding updated taxonomic information descriptions recorded original publication.

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: splist character vector containing species names queried. max_distance Maximum allowed distance fuzzy matching species names.

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: data frame containing comprehensive information provided species, including updated taxonomic details descriptions.

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: function checks species name provided list Red Book Endemic Plants Peru database. performs fuzzy matching based specified maximum distance. output includes information updated taxonomic details (accepted name, accepted family, accepted name author) complemented information recorded original publication (IUCN conservation category, bibliographic reference, collector, herbariums, common name, departmental registrations, ecological regions, protected natural areas (SINANPE), Peruvian herbaria, additional remarks).

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: Red Book Endemic Plants Peru World Checklist Vascular Plants, continuously updated resource exploring global plant diversity. Taxonomic Name Resolution Service - TNRS Plants World Online - Facilitated Royal Botanic Gardens - Kew.

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
code: # Example illustrating how to use the get_redbook function species_list <- c("Aphelandra cuscoensis", "Sanchezia ovata", "Piper stevensii") redbook_data <- get_redbook_data(species_list) head(redbook_data) #>           name_subitted         accepted_name accepted_family #> 1 Aphelandra cuscoensis Aphelandra cuscoensis     Acanthaceae #> 2       Sanchezia ovata       Sanchezia ovata     Acanthaceae #> 3       Piper stevensii       Piper stevensii      Piperaceae #>   accepted_name_author          redbook_name    iucn #> 1               Wassh. Aphelandra cuscoensis EN, B1a #> 2          Ruiz & Pav.    Sanchezia capitata      DD #> 3                Trel.       Piper stevensii    <NA> #>                                          publication           collector #> 1                 Phytologia 25(7): 469 - 470. 1973.  C. Vargas C. 15415 #> 2        Bull. Herb. Boissier, ser. 2, 4: 315. 1904. A. Mathews 1230 (K) #> 3 Field Mus. Nat. Hist., Bot. Ser. 13(2): 237. 1936.     F.L. Stevens 85 #>   herbariums  common_name dep_registry              ecological_regions #> 1       (US) Desconocido.           CU                 BHA; 470—520 m. #> 2       <NA> Desconocido.      JU - PA BMHP, BHA; altitud desconocida. #> 3       ILL. Desconocido.           JU Sin datos; altitud desconocida. #>        sinampe peruvian_herbariums #> 1          PNM            CUZ (1). #> 2 Sin registro            Ninguno. #> 3 Sin registro            Ninguno. #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                               remarks #> 1                                                       Hierba terrestre conocida solamente del sur del país, de las cuencas del Marcapata y del Madre de Dios. Aparentemente no ha vuelto a ser recolectada desde la década de 1960. #> 2 Esta especie arbustiva es conocida de dos localidades. La colección tipo fue recolectada en la cuenca del Pangoa en el siglo XVIII. Probablemente la expansión urbana y las actividades agrícolas sean problemas para esta especie. #> 3                                                                                    Este taxón fue considerado por Brako & Zarucchi (1993) como un endemismo; sin embargo, no ha sido posible evaluarlo, ni asignarle una categoría.

what: Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_tab
title: Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_tab
text: database contains comprehensive information regarding endemic plant species listed Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. endemic taxon accompanied corresponding variables detail taxonomic status, IUCN conservation category, bibliographic references, type collection details, common names, departmental registrations, ecological regions, protected natural areas (SINANPE), Peruvian herbaria specimens deposited, recorded original book.

title: Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_tab
Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_tab
text: data frame following variables: redbook_id Unique identifier species Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. redbook_name Scientific name endemic species. iucn Conservation category assigned according IUCN. publication Bibliographic reference taxon originally proposed. collector Name(s) collector(s) type specimen. herbariums Acronyms institutions type specimens taxon deposited. common_name Common names species mentioned literature. dep_registry Abbreviations departments taxon recorded. ecological_regions Abbreviations ecological regions proposed Zamora (1996). sinampe Abbreviation Protected Natural Area taxon recorded. peruvian_herbariums Acronyms Peruvian institutions type non-type specimens deposited. remarks Observations additional information endemic taxon.

title: Redbook Taxonomy Database — redbook_taxonomy
text: database contains taxonomic information endemic plant species Peru.

title: Redbook Taxonomy Database — redbook_taxonomy
Redbook Taxonomy Database — redbook_taxonomy
text: tibble: redbook_id Unique identifier species Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. redbook_name species name registered original dataset. accepted_name updated accepted scientific name species. accepted_family accepted family species. accepted_name_author author accepted scientific name. taxonomic_status taxonomic status species (Accepted, Synonym, opinion).

title: Redbook Taxonomy Database — redbook_taxonomy
text: database serves primary reference conducting partial exact searches species listed Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. information database standardized using Taxonomic Name Resolution Service (TNRS) World Checklist Vascular Plants (WCVP) ensure consistency accuracy.

title: Redbook Taxonomy Database — redbook_taxonomy
code: data(redbook_taxonomy) head(redbook_taxonomy) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   redbook_id redbook_name     accepted_name accepted_family accepted_name_author #>   <chr>      <chr>            <chr>         <chr>           <chr>                #> 1 1APCU      Aphelandra cusc… Aphelandra c… Acanthaceae     Wassh.               #> 2 2APHA      Aphelandra hapa… Aphelandra h… Acanthaceae     Wassh.               #> 3 3APJU      Aphelandra juni… Aphelandra j… Acanthaceae     Wassh.               #> 4 4APLA      Aphelandra lati… Aphelandra l… Acanthaceae     Wassh.               #> 5 5APVI      Aphelandra visc… Aphelandra v… Acanthaceae     Mildbr.              #> 6 6APWE      Aphelandra webe… Aphelandra w… Acanthaceae     Mildbr.              #> # ℹ 1 more variable: taxonomic_status <chr>
